title: Effect of change in chromosome number

content.description:
Figure 1. A karyotype obtained from a sample of human cells

A karyotype is a representation of all the metaphase chromosomes in a sample of cells from a particular individual (Figure 1).
content.question: Which of the following most likely explains how the chromosomes circled in Figure 1 could cause a genetic disorder in the person from whom the cells were obtained?

choices.label: The extra chromosome causes crowding in the nucleus of the cells and blocks <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> polymerase from binding to and transcribing certain genes.

The extra chromosome will affect the levels of <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> transcribed from certain genes and the amount of protein produced from those genes in each cell.
The cells will not divide and enable growth, because the extra chromosome will interfere with the pairing of homologous chromosomes.
The extra chromosome will cause other chromosomes in the cell to become triploid during future rounds of cell division.

content.answer: The extra chromosome will affect the levels of <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> transcribed from certain genes and the amount of protein produced from those genes in each cell.
